results.title: Metformin stimulates ischemia-induced revascularization through an eNOS dependent pathway in the ischemic hindlimb mice model.
results.text_hl: Our study indicates that, in addition to its @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@-lowering effect, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ fosters improved revascularization, which is responsible for its positive effect on @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Chronic_Limb_Threatening_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000089802 @@@critical limb ischemia@@@.

citations.NLM: Takahashi N, Shibata R, Ouchi N, Sugimoto M, Murohara T, Komori K. Metformin stimulates ischemia-induced revascularization through an eNOS dependent pathway in the ischemic hindlimb mice model. J Vasc Surg. 2015 Feb;61(2):489-96. PMID: 24993950
